mainHeadline.title: "I Built What?!" – A Collection of Dubious Achievements

projects.title: MindMesh
projects.subtitle: Project Management Tool • 2025

image1.caption: The dashboard where productivity goes to die (or thrive, depending on who you ask).

description: A project management tool that somehow manages projects while barely managing itself. Features includes authentication (because security is important, apparently), workspaces where teams can collectively ignore deadlines, tasks CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete... mostly Delete) & analytics to graphically display how behind schedule you are

Built with the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) because following trends is easier than original thought. Boasts "robust data integrity" which is developer-speak for "it hasn't lost all our data... yet." Additional features include real-time notifications to remind you of meetings you'll ignore, role-based permissions so you can blame the right person when things go wrong.

features.title: Questionable Features
items: Google Sign-In (so you can't blame forgetting passwords)
Roles & Permissions (Owner, Admin, Member... and Scapegoat)
Filters & Search (to find what you lost)
Cookie Session Management (because cookies make everything better)

image2.caption: Mobile version for managing your existential crisis on-the-go.

projects.title: AI-migo
projects.subtitle: AI Coding Assistant • 2025

image1.caption: The interface where you politely ask AI to write your code and pray it works.

description: An AI assistant that writes code while you question your life choices. Key questionable features include component generation (for when typing feels like manual labor), live previews that work approximately 83% of the time (disclaimer: percentage may vary based on moon phases), and Docker sandboxes essentially digital padded rooms for your experimental code.

Built with Next.js 15 (because version numbers are basically fashion trends) and tRPC (which we've decided stands for "Terrifyingly Random Programming Concepts"). The credit system carefully limits how much havoc you can wreak in a single session, think of it as parental controls for AI-generated spaghetti code. Additional "features" include error messages that range from "vaguely helpful" to "complete existential crisis."

features.title: Dubious Capabilities
items: Creates apps from prompts (that may not match expectations)
Supports multiple AI models (to increase confusion)
Cloud sandbox execution (to safely contain disasters)

image2.caption: Watching AI write code that somehow both impresses and terrifies you.
